I just came back from Barcelona, and too bad I didn't discover this place until my last day there.  The restaurant looks to be pretty small inside, but we sat outside in the square like most other patrons.  Our server was so nice and friendly.  They have a spanish menu outside the door but he handed us an English menu as he saw us staring blankly at their outside menu (yea, I took french in school not spanish, looking back not a great choice).  We had a great appetizer, the pate, which was very rich and smooth.  Their menu had "toasts" which were large in size and had toppings, kind of like a pizza but imaging toppings on a piece of toasted bread.  The spinach and goat cheese toast was great.  Our server said these were all his grandmother's recipes, how endearing, I like small homey restaurants so much!I really think I should've taken the advice of going into the smaller squares and side roads in Barcelona (especially in Barrio Gothic and other touristy areas) because my two favorite restaurants were discovered this way (and confirmed by yelp beforehand of course).
